Title: Voice Core (3G Core and VoLTE)
Description: This collection is presenting all courses related to 3G Voice Core (MSS/MGW) and VoLTE.

Title: Subscriber Data Management
Description:
Subscriber Data Management (SDM) brings fixed and mobile networks together by introducing a back-end common data store defined as a User Data Repository (UDR).  

  • There are two options for UDR available; One-NDS for bare metal cases and Shared Data Layer (SDL) for cloud native cases starting in release 18.

The UDR stores subscriber data for specific front end applications:

  • Combined HSS/HLR solution: CMS8200, NT HLR
  • One-EIR (Equipment Identity Register), 
  • One-MNP (Mobile Number Portability),
  • One-AAA  (Authentication, Authorization and Accounting.

Title: IP Networks
Description:
Contains the learning solutions offered to develop a good understanding of the technologies and workflow procedures to successfully implement, monitor and maintain SR OS product based IP/MPLS service networks.

Click on the solution domain for which you're trying to find a learning solution. Hover over the collections with your mouse pointer to the Nokia Products included in the solution.

Title: FTTx
Description: Fiber To The most economical point. Fiber and copper access products and services for service providers, utilities and governments to meet the demand for ultra-broadband. Our learning solutions allow telecom operators, cable operators, municipal governments and enterprises to mix and match fiber and copper ultra-broadband technologies to provide the best services to their subscribers, citizens and employees. These FTTx learning solutions help you use innovations like VDSL2 vectoring, G.fast, and micro-nodes to get more speed and value from your access network. They put your existing assets to work so you can roll out ultra-broadband services faster and get the fastest possible return on your investment.

Title: FTTH
Description: Fiber access solutions help you build Fiber-To-The-Home (FTTH) networks that can exceed users' expectations and hit tomorrow's bandwidth targets. We use our technology and expertise and learning solutions to ensure that you get the right strategy, deploy the best products, and streamline your operations.

Title: Cable (EPON/DPoE)
Description: Expand your cable access networks with Nokia high-capacity passive optical network (PON) solutions. And use Ethernet PON (EPON) with DOCSIS® provisioning of EPON (DPoE™) capabilities to manage an EPON network and integrate it smoothly into your existing infrastructure. Our learning solutions help you evolve your access network to address the changing needs of residential and business customers.

Description: Our passive optical LAN solutions help all types of organizations build LANs that support premium service experiences, reduce cost, and deliver value for decades. Select below any of the POL learning solutions for more details.

Title: FTTH Network Operations Engineer
Description:

• Have a good understanding of most features and building blocks across all domains (GPON, p2p fiber, L2 to L3+, equipment practice, mgmt. applications...) and be able to participate to or lead technical discussions.

• Identify and isolate equipment or software failures and retrieve or analyze standard service configurations for first fault detection. Perform ISAM software maintenance (SW download, DB switching & back-up & restore, excl. database migrations) & performance monitoring tasks.

• Configuration and first diagnosis of the fiber access layers for problem location. But also deploy, configure and diagnose any service or interface on the 73xx ISAM through CLI & 5520AMS.

Title: IP/MPLS Dimensioning & Planning
Description: NokiaEDU does not provide IP/MPLS Network Dimensioning and Planning training in its standard course training catalog.  Please refer to ****  for support in addressing your requirements.

Title: IP/MPLS Technology Overview
Description:
This collection includes courses with a focus on technologies commonly used in IP/MPLS networks, such as: Broadband Network Gateway/ Broadband Remote Access Service (BNG/BRAS); VPRN services (commonly referred to as Layer 3 VPN); Multicast VPN; IPv6 OAM; and, Quality of Service (QoS)

Prerequisites: These courses include complex topics and assume a baseline understanding pf IP/MPLS technologies and familiarity with the SR OS. Refer to the course description for more details.

Title: IP/MPLS Product Overview
Description:
This collection includes training related to the physical and virtual SR OS product family as well as basic OAM and security features. It also includes an overview of the GUI management system (5620 SAM).

The opportunity to ramp up on the features and functions of the SR OS is also provided and would be of particular interest to knowledgeable personnel with experience working with other vendor equipment.

Title: 7750 SR and 7450 ESS Product Overview
Description: The 7750 SR and 7450 ESS Product Overview course provides an introduction to the 7750 SR and 7450 ESS features, functionality, and network applications. The course highlights the product models and describes the 7750 SR and 7450 ESS hardware components.
More information: 7750 SR and 7450 ESS Product Overview

Title: 7950 XRS-20 Product Overview
Description: A new era of core routers was needed that could better scale, be more versatile and efficient. That is why Alcatel-Lucent has developed a new range of core routers.
Objectives:
Understand the need for a scalable, versatile and efficient core router.

Understand the most important components of the 7950 Extensible Routing System (7950 XRS-20).

Understand the commonalities with other SR-OS routers in Alcatel-Lucent’s portfolio.
More information: 7950 XRS Product Overview

Title: 7705 SAR Product Overview
Description: This course describes the characteristics of the 7705 SAR hardware components and software features up to and including Release 6.1R1 and provides an overview of the deployment in a converged network.
Objectives:
•Define the role of the 7705 SAR aggregation router in the aggregation and backhaul zone of the service provider network

•Identify how the 7705 SAR is used in the service provider network

•Describe the characteristics of the hardware and software components and features
More information: 7705 SAR Product Overview

Title: 7210 SAS Product Overview
Description: This course describes the characteristics of the 7210 SAS hardware and software features up to Release 6.0 and provides an overview of the deployment in a customer’s network
Objectives:
• Define the role of the 7210 SAS in a customer’s network

• Describe the benefits of the 7210 SAS

• Describe the 7210 SAS product portfolio

• Explain the key features and characteristics of the different 7210 SAS variants

• Describe the 1830 Versatile WDM Module and how it can be used with the 7210 SAS in a customer’s network
More information: 7210 SAS Product Overview

Title: 7750 Virtual Service Router
Description: Virtual Service Router is part of Alcatel-Lucent's Network Function Virtualization portfolio for the 7x50 platform. Two solutions are currently available to be virtualized, the Route Reflector and Simulator. The VSR-RR can be virtualized to perform a traditional 7x50's Route Reflecting functions in a virtualized environment. Also, the VSR-SIM is a virtualized solution where multiple 7x50's can be used for purposes such as but not limited to training, validation, and proof of concept operations.
Objectives:
• Understand the benefits of installing a Virtual Service Router – Simulator.

• Understand the benefits of installing a Virtual Service Router – Route Reflector.

• Know the minimum hardware requirements for a host.

• Know the resources to be allocated to a VSR-SIM and VSR-RR.

• Understand the necessary files for deploying a VSR and their function.

• Deploy a VSR-SIM in a KVM environment.

• Configure the necessary components for the VSR to communicate with internal devices (other VMs in same host) or externally (using NIC ports)
More information: Virtual Service Router

Title: SR-OS Fundamentals
Description: The SR-OS Fundamentals eLearning course describes the key essentials of the SR-OS service router portfolio. The different hardware products are described along with the aspects on how a service is built. It also explains the IP and MPLS fundaments needed to build this service.
Objectives:
Explain where the SR-OS service router is used in a high leverage network

Name the different SR-OS hardware products

Explain the fundamental aspects of IP and MPLS

Understand the key components of a service

Describe the different services

Explain the fundamentals of QoS and Multicast.
More information: SR-OS Fundamentals

Title: SR-OS Services Implementation
Description: This course is entirely devoted to providing students with a comprehensive hands-on training on fundamental SR-OS features, including IP routing, MPLS, services, and QoS.
Objectives: At the end of this course, the student will have extensive hands-on experience on how to use the Service Routing Operating System (SR OS), including basic system configuration, routing protocols, MPLS, different types of layer-2 and layer-3 services, and Quality of Service.
Prerequisites: TER36066W SR-OS Fundamentals eLearning or the TER36066 SR-OS Fundamentals (ILT)
More information: SR-OS Services Implementation

Title: SR-OS Layer 3 VPNs
Description: This course covers the description and implementation of L3VPNs known as Virtual Private Routed Networks (VPRNs) in the SR-OS system. A general overview is provided on L3VPNs, its different topologies and implementations of L3VPNs.
Objectives: By the end of the course, participants will be able to explain: • Describe the fundamental principle of Layer 3 Virtual Private Networks (L3VPN) • Identify various components and topologies for L3VPN • Describe the reason for using BGP as the signaling protocol in L3VPN • Describe and configure Virtual Private Routed Network (VPRN) in Full Mesh • Describe and configure Segment Routing in single instance ISIS • Describe and configure types Inter-AS L3VPN options • Describe and configure BGP Resiliency feature Fast-Reroute (FRR)
More information: Layer 3 VPNs

Title: SR-OS Next Generation Multicast Virtual Private Network (NG-MVPN)
Description: This course consists of 2 days of training on the Next Generation Multicast Virtual Private Network (NG MVPN). It includes a mix of six modules of instructor presentation and practical hands-on lab exercises. The course begins with a brief overview of the NG multicast solution, and addresses why the solution is needed. Subsequent modules cover how the BGP address family is used to support MVPN auto-discovery and C-multicast signaling; how BGP auto-discovery can be used to create the PMSIs; how RSVP-TE P2MP LSPs and mLDP P2MP LSPs are used to instantiate PMSIs is also covered; and how to configure, verify and troubleshoot NG MVPN on the Alcatel-Lucent Service Router (SR) platforms.
Objectives:
By the end of the course, participants will be able to:

• Explain the requirement for NG MVPNs and the problems they solve

• Illustrate how the BGP address family used to support MVPN auto-discovery and C-multicast signaling

• Describe how BGP auto-discovery can be used to create the PMSIs

• Explain how RSVP-TE P2MP LSPs and mLDP P2MP LSPs are used to instantiate PMSIs

• Explain how to configure, verify and troubleshoot Next Generation MVPN on the Alcatel-Lucent SR platforms
More information: Next Generation Multicast VPN

Title: SR-OS Quality of Service
Description: This course assumes that students have basic knowledge of quality of service (QoS) techniques, including classification, queueing and marking. The course builds on this basic knowledge and describes additional techniques that can be used to create an efficient and effective QoS environment. This course explains in detail the two options available to deal with traffic burstiness on the SR-OS: policing an shaping. These, incidentally, are essential components of QoS packet processing.
More information: Quality of Service

Title: SR-OS IPv6 Operations, Administration, Maintenance and Provisioning
Description:
This course provides the students with a comprehensive view and understanding of IPv6. The course starts by describing the new header format and addressing scheme, as well as the mechanisms that are available to dynamically assign global unicast addresses to the hosts; namely, stateless and stateful mechanisms based on ICMPv6 and DHCPv6, respectively.

The course also describes the many additional roles that ICMPv6 plays in IPv6 networks, including duplicate address detection, link-layer address resolution (equivalent to ARP in IPv4), neighbor unreachability detection, and multicast listener discovery.

Also covered are topics such as IPv6 packet filters and VRRP as a way of adding resilience to a network by configuring redundant gateway routers.

The course goes on to explaining the way routing protocols work for IPv6 prefixes. It describes in detail how both interior (OSPFv3, IS-IS) and exterior (BGP) routing protocols exchange information and build route tables. Static route configuration is also covered.

Note: regarding interior routing protocols, the course is designed to cover either OSPFv3 or IS-IS in a standard delivery, which needs to be specified when the customer requirement is received. If training in both OSPFv3 and IS-IS is required, a customized training request must be filed to make the necessary arrangements.

To make learning more effective, the course has practical hands-on exercises for all topics, which helps the students put into practice what they learned regarding how the different SR-OS features are configured and verified.
More information: IPv6 Operation, Administration, Maintenance and Provisioning

Title: SR-OS Security Gateway IPSEC
Description: This course provides an overview of IPSec concepts and applications, including a hardware overview of the most current features, scaling, resiliency load sharing features. The overview is followed by case studies and hands-on exercises to explain how to configure IPSec end to end between 7750 Service Routers.
Objectives:
Describe the functions and services offered by Ipsec

Cite the main network architectures using the 7750 Security Gateway

Configure ISA-tunnel

Manage static and dynamic site to site tunnel

Manage remote access tunnel in small cell backhaul environment

Manage the Multi-chassis redundancy

Use OAM and diagnostic commands to check the Ipsec configuration on the 7750 Security Gateway

Manage Keys and certificates
More information: SR Security Gateway (IPSEC)

Title: SR-OS 7750 BNG/BRAS ESM Provisioning using CLI and 5620 SAM
Description:
Alcatel-Lucent's 7750 service routers can be deployed as the Broadband Network Gateway (BNG) or the Broadband Remote Access Server (BRAS) for triple-play (Internet, IPTV, Phone) service deployment. The 7750's Enhanced Subscriber Management (ESM) feature offers the flexibility and QoS assurance for subscribers for their triple-play services.

The provisioning of the ESM feature on the 7750 service router for BNG or BRAS operations can be done via either the 7750 CLI or the Alcatel-Lucent 5620 SAM. This training course focuses on both the provisioning methods.
More information: BNG/BRAS ESM

Title: IP/MPLS Configuration & Administration
Description: Configuration management is concerned with monitoring system configuration information, and any changes that take place. This area is especially important, since many network issues arise as a direct result of changes made to configuration files, updated software versions, or changes to system hardware. A proper configuration management strategy involves tracking all changes made to network hardware and software.

Title: IP/MPLS Operations
Description:
Targeted Audience:

This learning path is of interest to those personnel whose daily tasks Includes: basic network and service OA&M procedures; more advanced surveillance and fault resolution responsibilities but must be completed within a maximum time frame before escalating to higher echelon for resolution.

Recommended training:

SR OS Product Overview, or equivalent knowledge. See IP Networks, IP/MPLS Product Overview for details.

Title: IP/MPLS Network Maintenance
Description:
Target Audience:

Those personnel who are responsible to design, implement and manage more complex configuration and fault resolution functions, including: QoS; Layer 1 – Layer 3 Resiliency; Policy Management; etc…

Recommended training: The courses in this collection deal with complex topics for which learners would benefit from having comprehensive understanding of the concepts and principles to configure, monitor and maintain an IP/MPLS based service network. Refer to the appropriate course description for details.

Title: Service Routing Certifications
Description:
The Service Routing Certification Program is Nokia's premier training and certification program for IP networking and technical support professionals. The program is designed to equip participants with the skills, confidence, and credibility needed to work in today’s advanced IP network and service environments.

Whether you are a professional involved with supporting business VPNs, residential broadband, mobile backhaul, mobile core, or evolving cloud-optimized networks and services, the SRC program offers the training and resources needed to help you succeed with your job and your career.

Visit the Service Router Certification homepage at https://networks.nokia.com/src

Know which product variant (7302/7330/7356/7360 etc) to position or use in any given network architecture. Understand the product architecture and know which specific HW to use for the situation. It provides a thorough understanding of the broadband access management portfolio and design integration of them in a management network And gives a good understanding of most features & building blocks across all domains (DSL, GPON, p2p fiber, L2 to L3+ forwarding models, equipment practice, mgmt applications…) after which you'll be able to participate to or lead technical discussions.

Title: Nokia Network Routing Specialist I (NRS I)
Description: The NRS I certification is the starting point for the Nokia Service Routing Certification (SRC) Program designed for students with little knowledge of IP and data networking.  NRS I training provides fundamental knowledge in IP addressing, TCP/IP,  Ethernet, and internet routing protocols. The NRS I certification establishes a solid, base foundation in IP technology and prepares individuals to advance further in the program with additional courses and/or certifications.
Objectives:
NRS I Key Learning Outcomes

Upon successful completion, students will be familiar with the fundamentals of TCP/IP, routing, routing protocols, IP addressing and carrier Ethernet services, and will be well positioned to further advance their level of knowledge and skills in IP service routing. Refer to the NRS I certification brochure for further details on learning objectives.
Duration: Please refer to the Certification details for more details.
Prerequisites:
Certification Requirements

Exam requirements and recommended courses for acquiring the NRS I certification are provided in the table below. Candidates are not required to enroll in the recommended course to achieve the NRS I certification however passing the mandatory written exam (4A0-100) is required.
More information: Nokia Network Routing Specialist I (NRS I) Certification

Title: Nokia Network Routing Specialist II (NRS II)
Description: The Nokia Network Routing Specialist II (NRS II) certification builds on the foundational knowledge established in the NRS I certification. The goal of NRS II training is to provide students with a strong foundation in the core aspects of Nokia service routing including the Internet Routing Protocol (IRP), IP/MPLS networks, and implementing Nokia layer 2 and layer 3 services.
Objectives:
NRS II Key Learning Outcomes

Upon successfully obtaining NRS II certification, students will have acquired a thorough working knowledge of IP routing protocols, IP/MPLS protocols and networking, VPN and VPLS services, basic OAM techniques, and various resiliency techniques. Students will also understand the Nokia network and services architecture and how to utilize it for delivering residential and business communication services. Refer to the NRS II certification brochure for further details on learning objectives.
Prerequisites:
Certification Requirements

Exam requirements and recommended courses for acquiring the NRS II certification are provided in the table below. Candidates are not required to enroll in the recommended course to achieve the NRS II certification however passing the mandatory exams and the NRS II practical lab exam are required.

For the certification exams below, candidates have the option to write the single NRS II Composite Exam (4A0-C01) OR write the following three individual exams.

Nokia Interior Routing Protocols (4A0-101)

Nokia Multiprotocol Label Switching (4A0-103)

Nokia Services Architecture (4A0-104)

The NRS II Composite Exam (4A0-C01) combines content from three individual exams into a single, integrated exam. Refer to the NRS II Composite exam page for further details.
More information: Nokia Network Routing Specialist II (NRS II) Certification

Title: Nokia Triple Play Routing Professional (3RP)
Description: The Nokia Triple Play Routing Professional (3RP) certification is designed to provide senior network engineers and operations and planning staff with the knowledge and skills needed to build, deliver, and support advanced broadband residential IP services including voice, video, data and IPTV.
Objectives:
3RP Key Learning Outcomes

Upon successfully obtaining 3RP certification, students will have the training and skills required to design, operate, and manage large scale residential service networks and enable network transformation for large-scale IPTV and video-on-demand service rollouts. Additional key learning outcomes include detailed understanding of quality of service (QoS) and the design of highly reliable and scalable virtual private LAN service (VPLS). Refer to the 3RP certification brochure for further details on learning objectives.
Duration: Please refer to the Certification description for more details
Prerequisites:
Certification Requirements

Exam requirements and recommended courses for acquiring the 3RP certification are provided in the table below. Candidates are not required to enroll in the recommended courses to achieve the MRP certification however passing the mandatory written exams and the NRS II practical lab exam are required.

For the certification exams below, candidates have the option to write the single NRS II Composite Exam (4A0-C01) OR write the following three individual exams.

Nokia Interior Routing Protocols (4A0-101)

Nokia Multiprotocol Label Switching (4A0-103)

Nokia Services Architecture (4A0-104)

The NRS II Composite Exam (4A0-C01) combines content from three individual exams into a single, integrated exam. Refer to the NRS II Composite exam page for further details.
More information: Nokia Triple Play Routing Professional (3RP) Certification

Title: Nokia Service Routing Architect (SRA)
Description: The Nokia Service Routing Architect (SRA) certification is the highest level certification in the SRC program.  The SRA certification is designed for engineers who have the ambition to become an expert in all aspects of designing, building, and supporting Service Router networks and services.  In addition to successfully completing the required exams, SRA certification requires candidates to pass a one-day practical lab exam.
Objectives:
SRA Key Learning Outcomes

Upon successfully obtaining SRA certification, students will have developed additional, in-depth working knowledge in areas such as Border Gateway Protocol (BGP), Virtual Private LAN Service (VPLS), Virtual Private Routed Networks (VPRN), and Quality of Service (QoS). Refer to the SRA certification brochure for further details on learning objectives.
Prerequisites:
Certification Requirements

Candidates have the option to write the single SRA Composite Exam (4A0-C02) OR write the following four individual exams.

Nokia Border Gateway Protocol (Exam #4A0-102)

Nokia Virtual Private Lan Services (Exam #4A0-105)

Nokia Virtual Private Routed Networks (Exam #4A0-106)

Nokia Quality of Service (Exam #4A0-107)

The SRA Composite Exam (Exam #4A0-C02) combines content from four individual exams into a single, integrated exam. Refer to the SRA Composite exam page for further details.

Candidates must write at least one of the elective exams listed below.

Exam requirements and recommended courses for acquiring the SRA certification are provided in the table below. Candidates are not required to enroll in the recommended course to achieve the SRA certification, however, passing the mandatory exams and the SRA practical lab exam are required.
More information: Nokia Service Routing Architect (SRA) Certification

Title: Mobile Networks Certifications
Description:
Ensuring maximum value and return on your investment

The Nokia Mobile Networks Certification Programs are designed to support the migration to the next generation of cellular networks. The program features an in-depth curriculum and practical skills focused on accelerating the performance of individuals who design, plan, operate and support mobile networks solutions.

Title: IP & Optical Networks Operations
Description: This domain includes that learning solutions required to manage IP and Optical network.  The training solutions are further categorized as IP Networks and Optical Networks within this domain.  Click on the appropriate folder to view the learning track.

Title: IP & Optical Networks Dimension & Planning
Description:
Covers 1830 EPT and 1390 NPT planning tools to plan an 1830 PSS optical network.

Hover over the collections with your mouse pointer to get an idea what Nokia Products are covered inside.

NOTE:

Title: IP & Optical Networks Configuration & Administration
Description: Configuration management is concerned with monitoring system configuration information, and any changes that take place. This area is especially important, since many network issues arise as a direct result of changes made to configuration files, updated software versions, or changes to system hardware. A proper configuration management strategy involves tracking all changes made to network hardware and software.

Title: SR-OS Administration, Maintenance and User Security
Description:
The course presents SR-OS capabilities that cover administration and maintenance topics such as system configuration and initialization, system management and security, and user security.

The course is designed to help system administrators perform tasks in the following areas: NE basic configuration and initialization, remote access configuration, card configuration, SNMP configuration, software upgrades, system security, and user security.
Objectives:
By the end of this course, participants will be able to:

- Configure an NE, and verify NE operation after installation,

- Describe the NE boot sequence and the files associated with it,

- Set up an NE so that it can be managed from a remote location,

- Configure NE cards,

- Configure SNMPv3 on NEs

- Perform standard software upgrades,

- Understand system security threats and apply system security recommendations,

- Understand the Authentication, Authorization and Accounting user security model-including RADIUS and TACACS+ configuration,

- Configure an NE using a pre-provisioned file.
More information: SR OS Admin, Maint & User Security

Title: SR-OS Express for Experienced Professionals
Description:
This course is intended as an intensive hands-on session for experienced network support personnel looking to quickly transition to the SR-OS from Cisco/Juniper/Huawei/etc... operating environments without covering basic theoretical concepts.

Other that a summary of the SR-OS product portfolio to highlight the key features and provide context to the lab experiences, there is no other theory component; therefore, it is not suitable for those personnel who are newly exposed to the technologies and concepts related to IP/MPLS based networks.
Objectives:
By the end of the course, participants will be :

-Familiar with the SR-OS product portfolio, including a high-level understanding of the key features and differentiators of the SR-OS products

-Proficient in using the SR-OS CLI to configure, monitor and troubleshoot SR-OS based IP/MPLS networks and Services as compared to other vendors’ operating environment

-Familiar with various “Tips and Tricks” available in the SR-OS
More information: SR OS for Experienced Professionals

Title: 5620 SAM Fundamentals
Description:
This 5620 SAM Fundamentals hands-on course provides technical personnel and network operators with foundations for using SAM to: perform network equipment discovery, management, monitoring and supervision; identify alarms rose against equipment and services; obtain details about alarm management and filtering, and alarm types, severity, status and correlation.

A 10h WBT version (TOS36033WS0K_v2.0) is available and includes interactive exercises.
Prerequisites: Technical English

Title: Network Management (552x)
Description: The 5520 Access Management System (AMS) delivers a complete element management solution for the Nokia Intelligent Services Access Manager (ISAM) family of DSL and fiber-based broadband access products. Below learning solutions are for those focusing only on the fixed access management applications and not ISAM operations. None of the solutions here cover how to operate or configure the ISAM products through the 5520 AMS application. Please refer to the FTTx or FTTH learning collections for this.

Title: Network Analyzer Copper
Description: Use Network Analyzer – Copper (NA–C) to ensure that your digital subscriber lines (DSLs) deliver the quality and stability you need to succeed with high-speed internet and triple-play services. Motive NA-C is a market-proven integrated line testing, diagnosis and optimization solution that maximizes DSL performance with automation provided by Dynamic Line Management (DLM). It lets you apply operational best practices across the entire access line lifecycle, from planning, prequalification and provisioning to maintenance, troubleshooting and customer support. The result: comprehensive and efficient DSL lifecycle management.

Title: Network Analyzer Fiber
Description: The Network Analyzer – Fiber (NA-F) helps service providers ensure that the passive optical network (PON) links meet quality of service (QoS) requirements for the successful deployment of high-bandwidth services over a GPON and NGPON-2 fiber access network. With NA-F you can minimize the number of degradations to prevent service failures where possible and repair faults quickly and predictably when they occur. It provides unique diagnostic and enhanced fault localization capabilities that enables the identification of root causes for issues, dramatically reducing the time and resources required for fault identification and resolution.

Title: 9500 MPR Split Mount (ETSI -ANSI) + Full Indoor ANSI
Description: This curriculum aims at providing the necessary knowledge about main functionalities, architecture, hardware, provisioning and maintenance of 9500 MPR network elements, It fits to Split mount (for ETSI and ANSI) and to full indoor ANSI  installations.
More information:
This training consists of these courses that should be taken in the listed order:

9500 MPR Global Market Functional and HW description (TWT42035)

9500 MPR Global Market Common Functionalities- NETO CT (TWT42036 (**) alternatives)

9500 MPR Global Market Common Functionalities- Web CT  (TWT00011  (**) alternatives )

9500 MPR Global Market Ethernet traffic (TWT42037 (***) alternatives )

9500 MPR Global Market Ethernet traffic- Web T (TWT00013 (***) alternatives )

9500 MPR Global Market PDH/SDH/SONET traffic (TWT42040 (*) optional)

9500 MPR Global Market Ring Protection  (TWT42041 (*) optional )

Title: 9500 MPT Sub 6
Description: These are O&M courses based upon the 9500MPT-Sub6 radio equipment addressing Point to Point or Point to Multipoint configurations. Each course  includes the description of the main features, hardware, architecture and the equipment management via the Managing Computer. It also includes a review on the technology used in NLOS environment. Maintenance aspects like Fault isolations and HW replacement are part of the course.
Duration: If both courses are required the global duration can be reduced to 4 days.
More information:
9500 MPT Sub6 Point to Point configuration O&M  ( TWT63048 (*) alternatives )

Title: FTTx Network Operations Engineer High Capacity NT
Description:
Designed for professionals who need to specialize in Broadband Access ISAM products with any of the high capacity NT types and understand the different aspects of fiber and copper access technologies and the challenges involved. All configuration tasks for all common services (HSI, voice, video) are covered in this level. It also covers common maintenance & troubleshooting activities.

This training package also includes the FTTx Technology solution.

Nokia has established a FTTx Certification Program.

The certification level linked to the FTTx Network Operations Engineer High Capacity NT learning is the 'CNP FBA FTTx ISAM High Cap. NT Integration, Operations & Maintenance' certification

Title: FTTx Network Optimizer Copper
Description:
Designed for a professional that needs to become an expert on the different xDSL access layers used in Access Networks. This includes complete design and roll-out strategies along with configurations, expert parameter settings etc.

All major technologies are covered: VDSL2, Vectoring, FAST, ARQ, ...

See Prerequisites!

Nokia has established a FTTx Certification Program.

The certification level linked to the FTTx Network Optimizer Copper learning is the

'CNX FBA xDSL Layer Architect' certification
Duration: Min. learning: 7 days of instructor led training
Prerequisites:
As a prerequisite, the trainee needs to have one of the following options completed:

- FTTx Installation Engineer (FTTx Deployment - Full path)

- FTTx Commissioning Engineer (FTTx Deployment - Full path)

- FTTx Network Operations Engineer HC NT (FTTx High Capacity NT Integration, Operation and Maintenance - Full path)

- FTTx Field Maintenance Technician HC NT (FTTx High Capacity NT Integration, Operation and Maintenance - Full path)

- FTTx Maintenance Engineer HC NT (FTTx High Capacity NT Integration, Operation and Maintenance - Full path)

Title: FTTH Maintenance Engineer
Description:
Designed for professionals who need to specialize in Broadband Access ISAM products for FTTH deployment and understand the different aspects of the fiber access technologies and the challenges involved.

• Have a good understanding of most features and building blocks across all domains (GPON, p2p fiber, L2 to L3+, equipment practice, mgmt. applications...) and be able to participate to or lead technical discussions.

• Identify and isolate equipment or software failures and retrieve or analyze standard service configurations for first fault detection. Perform ISAM software maintenance (SW download, DB switching & back-up & restore, excl. database migrations) & performance monitoring tasks.

• Configuration and first diagnosis of the fiber access layers for problem location. But also deploy, configure and diagnose any service or interface on the 73xx ISAM through CLI & 5520AMS.

This training package is including the FTTH Technology solution

Nokia has established a FTTH Certification Program.

The certification level linked to the FTTH Commissioning Engineer learning is the

'CNP FBA FTTH Integration, Operations & Maintenance' certification

Title: Network Analyzer Copper Optimizer
Description:
This training handles the dynamic line management and how it can be used in a copper access network. It will also help in learning how to configure and use the Network Analyzer Copper to activate DLM in your network.This is about the diagnosis driven DLM functionality that is based on the use of the per line override parameters of the ISAM.

It will also provide a detailed insight in to the narrow-band line test capabilities of the Network Analyzer Copper (MELT).

As well as a detailed insight in the single ended line test capabilities of the Network Analyzer Copper (SELT).

Title: EdenNet Optimization
Description:
EdenNet for personnel who plan and optimize GSM, WCDMA and LTE networks.

You will learn to execute Eden-NET modules such as: ANR, PCE, RCO, CCO, MLB, PRACH Optimization, APOI and MRO. 

The focus of the course is to teach participants to use Eden-NET modules for daily operations.
Objectives:
• use Eden NET Graphical User Interface
  • Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR) SON module(s) in network
  • Parameter Consistency Enforcement (PCE) SON module(s) in network
  • Reuse Code Optimization (RCO) SON module(s) in network
  • Coverage & Capacity Optimization (CCO) SON module(s) in network
  • Mobility Load Balancing (MLB) SON module(s) for WCDMA and LTE in network
  • LTE Mobility Robustness (MRO) SON module
  • PRACH optimization
  • Automatic Parameter Optimization (APO)
  • Carrier Aggregation for LTE
  • Energy Saving Management
Prerequisites:
Knowledge in telecommunications– preferably in the Radio Mobile Networks field.

EdenNet Overview
More information: Eden-NET Self optimization| OS8465-17A-NRM

Title: IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS)-CFX-5000 17.0 Administration Curriculum
Audience: This curriculum consists of four courses applicable to IMS (CFX-5000) release 17 whether on ATCA, HP platforms or VmWare.  They are Introduction to the Nokia IMS Solution, CFX-5000 delta from 16.5 to 17, CFX-5000 System Administration and CFX/CMS IMS 17.0 Functional Delta from Bare Metal to Cloud.
Description: This curriculum is required for customers who need to administer and maintain the Nokia CFX-5000 on ATCA, HP platforms or VmWare. The Introduction to the Nokia IMS Solution describes IMS concepts and the Nokia IMS Solution components. The delta course describes the differences between CFX-5000 release 16.5 and 17.0. The system administration course provides an overview of CFX-5000 release 17.0 functions, features, architecture, registration, session handling, roaming and message flows. The functional delta course describes the operational differences between CFX-5000 and CMS-8200 on bare metal platforms (ATCA and HP) and Cloud.
Objectives:
Upon completion of this curriculum, students will be able to
  • Describe IMS concepts and the Nokia IMS Solution components and their functions.
  • Describe the differences between CFX-5000 release 16.5 and 17.0
  • Describe the fundamentals of IP Multimedia Subsystems (IMS)
  • Describe the Nokia IMS solution
  • Describe the IMS hardware
  • Practice administration of IMS registration-related features
  • Practice administration of break-out/break-in related IMS features
  • Practice administration of VoLTE-related IMS sessions handling and roaming features
  • Practice administration of IMS Charging
  • Describe the virtual CFX-5000
  • Describe the virtual CMS-8200
  • Describe the CFX-5000 and CMS-8200 operational differences between the CFX-5000 and CMS-8200 on bare metal platforms versus Cloud.
Prerequisites:
• Knowledge of Linux
  • Knowledge of TCIP protocols
  • Knowledge of NetAct IMS management
More information:
Introduction to the Nokia IMS Solution (22 mins.)

CFX/CMS - IP Multimedia Subsystem Delta IMS 16.5 to IMS 17 (1 day)

CFX-5000 - System Administration IMS 17 (4 days)

CFX/CMS IMS 17.0 Functional Delta from Bare Metal to Cloud (2 hrs.)

The goal of Nokia Autonomous Customer Care solution is to resolve customer issues in the shortest time, with the least number of steps and human interventions.

Description: This curriculum describes advanced and expert topics related to 3G Core system. The subjects discussed are MSS ad MGW troubleshooting, routing, signalling, call control and features.
Objectives:
The participant will be able to:
  • perform call failure trouble shooting;
  • trace and interpret the signaling on different transmission interfaces in core network and interpret the significance of parameters;
  • describe the implementation of the User Plane Analysis; explain the interdependencies of the features;
  • plan and define the application of most major routing features of the DX200 MSS;
  • list the programs involved in various stages of a call, as well as the computer units in which they reside;
  • use message monitoring as a possible troubleshooting tool.
Prerequisites: Good general expertise of UMTS Core network technology regarding protocols, interfaces and procedures.
More information: Nokia Voice Core Specialist | CUCN1003-15A (Curriculum)

Title: Eden-NET Overview (WBT)
Description: Eden-NET Overview is a prerequisite for all other Eden-NET courses. It introduces SON, describes Eden-NET architecture and presents Eden-NET modules and Eden-NET user interface.
Objectives:
• explain the purpose of SON (Self Organizing Network) and the major benefits that SON brings to network operators
  • explain the benefits of Eden-NET framework , architecture and interfaces
  • explain how Eden-NET Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR) module enables operators to optimize and automate Neighbor Relations
  • explain how Eden-NET Mobility Robustness Optimization (MRO) module enables operators to optimize handovers
  • explain how Eden-NET Reuse Code Optimization (RCO) module enables operators to reallocate Scrambling code (WCDMA) and PCI reuse (LTE) in an optimal way
  • explain how Eden-NET Coverage and Capacity Optimization (CCO) module enables operators to optimize Coverage and Capacity by modifying RET (Remote Electrical Tilt) parameters
  • explain how Eden-NET Mobility Load Balancing (MLB) module enables operators to balance load between cells by modifying CPICH and CIO parameters
  • explain how Eden-NET Sleeping Cell Resolution enables operators to identify sleeping cells and reset them
  • explain how Eden-NET Crossed Antenna Detection enables operators to detect human mistakes during new site deployment or existing site maintenance
  • explain how Eden-NET Parameter Consistency Enforcement enables operators to audit and monitor network configuration
  • explain how Eden-NET Plug and Play module enables operators to automate site creation 
  • use Eden-NET GUI to visualize KPI and browse topology
Prerequisites: None
More information: Eden-NET Overview (WBT)  (OS8460-17A - 1 hour)

Title: CloudBand: CBIS Description
Audience: CloudBand Infrastructure Software Description. (ref CB00303)
Description: This eLearning covers the CloudBand Infrastructure Software Description.
Objectives:
By the end of the course, participants will be able to:

•Describe the main components of CBIS solution

•Describe the CBIS functional architecture

•Describe and explain the CBIS basic principles

•Explain the CBIS management implementation

•Describe the CBIS Monitoring main components: zabbix, etc.

•Explain the implementation of 3rd party software (Elastic search, Kibana and logstash) for external logging

•Describe CBIS High Availability mechanisms

•Understand Statefull and stateless in OpenStack

•Describe OpenStack HA implementation

•Describe overview of databases replication mechanisms

•Describe CBIS Storage Service

•Describe the CBIS networking implementation

•List the available hardware options supported by CBIS

•List the Enhanced Platform Awareness features enabled by CBIS

•Describe the Nokia Airframe hardware solution

•Describe HP C7000 hardware solution for CBIS

•Describe Dell PowerEdge hardware for CBIS

•Describe CBIS Networking

•Describe CBIS Layer 2 networking implementation

•Describe the L3 networking implementation

•Explain how Nuage provides SDN
Duration: 2 hours, 27 minutes in eLearning, 7hours in classroom
Prerequisites: Having a background on cloud computing, virtualization paradigms and software approaches to the traditional telecommunications infrastructure is better. TelcoCloud - Overview is recommended.
Testimonials: The goal of the training is to describe and give understanding of the CloudBand Infrastructure Software. The training covers the description of the solution, the architecture, the basic principle, terminology and the implementation. It is intended to customers as well as internal Nokia employees. For Nokia employees, this training may serves as preparation to CloudBand Certification CNA level, for the CBIS product.
More information:
We recommend the following learning path to access your training.

CB00303 may be ILT or WBT.

TelcoCloud and CloudBand overview (CB00150 - WBT 2h)

CloudBand Introduction (CB00321 - WBT 2h)

Title: TelcoCloud - and CloudBand Overview - English version
Audience: TelcoCloud for beginners.
Description: This e-learning  explains Telco Cloud in simple terms.
Objectives:
The ‘Nokia Telco Cloud introduction for all’ e- learning training is divided into three key modules including:

Technology: This module provides high level overview on how technologies such as network functions virtualization (NFV), software defined networking (SDN) and cloud computing are used to build the Telco Cloud

Strategy: In this module you will get to know - what is Nokia´s strategy in the direction of Networks in the Cloud, Business in the Cloud and eventually – Nokia in the Cloud.

Impact: This module highlights how various roles within Nokia (some typical roles, such as Sales, Services, R&D and IT) may evolve with the move to Telco Cloud.
Testimonials: Telco Cloud is changing the landscape by introducing technologies like cloud computing, virtualization paradigms and software approaches to the traditional telecommunications infrastructure.Do you want to understand what Telco Cloud is all about? Get to understand Telco Cloud with ‘ Nokia Telco Cloud introduction for all’ - a new e-learning training course that explains Telco Cloud in simple terms which is comprehensible for everyone
More information: TelcoCloud - Overview ( TAP00024 - WBT 2h)

Title: CloudBand: CBAM Description
Audience: CBAM  Description (Ref CB00306)
Description: This eLearning covers the CloudBand Application Manager Description.
Objectives:
To enable students to:

Describe Basics Concepts of CBAM relative to ETSI NFV MANO Architecture.

Briefly explain Life Cycle Management with respect to VNF.

Describe the Functional Architecture of CBAM.

Discuss various Technologies involved in designing the CBAM.

Explain resource requirement for CBAM towards Cloud.

Overview of Key Template Format in CBAM.

Explain VNFD template Topology Structure.

Identify different parameters to write VNFD Templates.

Briefly Explain Nokia Customization to VNFD template topology structure.

Highlight the ETSI and Openstack Mappings parameters.

Describe How CBAM uses HOT, Mistral and Ansible Template.

Discuss different Template parameters in Hot and Mistral workflows.

Explain Ansible playbooks using example.

Explain VNF Manager interworking with Net-Act.

Describe CBAM operability.

Explain the Logical Extended Architecture of CBAM with individual Software blocks.

Explain How CBAM is deployed in Vmware.

Templates mapping between Vmware world and Openstack World
Testimonials:
This training covers the CloudBand Application Manager Description.

CBAM designed by Nokia fits in NFV Arena and provides means for VNF integrators to execute various VNF lifecycle management operations on an OpenStack Kilo and Liberty cloud.

The training gives an understanding of the CBAM software architecture, functional components and resources for VNF deployment. In addition, the training will explain concepts behind MISTRAL workflows and Ansible Playbooks, covering How TOSCA is potentially utilized to bind different workflows engines. It is intented to customers as well as internal Nokia employees. For Nokia employees, this training may serves as preparation to CloudBand Certification CNA level - CBAM related exam. Title: Traffica
Description:
Traffica is a real-time network analytics tool that provides monitoring and troubleshooting while giving insights into traffic, network, locations, devices and subscribers. This learning solution addressed understanding, configuring, maintaining, and operating Traffica.

Traffica User WBT is the mandatory prerequisite for all the other Traffica courses.

Traffica Administrator is needed by all Traffica key users. 

Traffica User Index is a list of training available not a curricula. For each adaptation, there is a specific training showing how Traffica can best support this adaptation.  for e.g. Traffica for e-Node B:

  • The Web Based Training will show only the specific use cases on e-Node B. And therefore, participant needs to take beforehand Traffica User training to learn the Traffica tools. 
  • The Instructor Lead training will cover the Traffica tools and their use cases (2 days). This is why if you need training for more than one adaptation, for e.g. Traffica for e-Node B and Traffica for RNC, total duration will be 3 days (as the first day is common to all technologies.

Title: FBA 5529 IDM, OAD & SDC Operator
Description:
Designed for professionals who need to specialize in the 5529 IDM, OAD & SDC plugins of the 5520 AMS. Obtain a full understanding on how to operate the IDM, OAD & SDC and retrieve results through them. There's no certification exam for this level.

IDM = Inventory Data Manager

OAD = Object Alarm Dispatcher

SDC = Statistics & Data Collector
Prerequisites: Having completed one or more of the Integration, Operations & Maintenance learning programs on the ISAM (FTTx or FTTH).
More information: FBA 5529 IDM, OAD & SDC Operator (TAC03509K - 9h)

Designed for a professional that needs to become an expert on the use and integration of a 5529APC in a fixed access management network.

Obtain a full understanding on the use of templates and stacks and how to apply these via the 5520 AMS or via a northbound interface. There's no certification exam for this level.

More information: FBA 5529 APC Service Integrator (TAC03511K - 12,75h)

Title: Session Border Controller (SBC) 3.0 Curriculum for Operations, Performance and Maintenance
Audience: This curriculum consists of three Session Border Controller (SBC) release 3.0 courses.  They are Session Border Controller Overview, Session Border Controller OAMP Concepts and Session Border Controller OAMP Workshop.
Description: The curriculum is required for customers and Nokia internal technicians who need to operate and maintain the Nokia Session Border Controller (SBC). The curriculum will provide an overview of SBC release 3.0 functions, features, architecture, OAMP concepts and user interfaces. The workshop will provide hands-on exercises for performing OAM&P tasks.
Objectives:
Upon completion of this curriculum, students will be able to
  • Describe the SBC architecture
  • Describe the main functions and key features of the SBC
  • List the applications running on the SBC
  • Describe the operation, adminiistration and maintenance interfaces, their purpose and the element management systems
  • Examine configuration data of various functional elements
  • Perform configuration management tasks
  • Perform fault management tasks
  • Perform hardware maintenance tasks
  • Perform accounting management tasks
  • Perform software management tasks
  • Perform security management tasks
Prerequisites:
• Knowledge of general IMS concepts and architecture
  • Basic knowledge of general telecom and data (TCP/IP protocol suite and SIP) principles is recommended
More information:
SBC Overview (2 hours)

SBC Operations, Administration, Maintenance and Provisioning Concepts (1 day)

SBC OAMP Concepts Workshop (1 day)

Title: Field Maintenance
Description:
Targeted Audience:

Personnel responsible for the surveillance of hardware for visual indications of fault conditions (alarm lights, buzzers, etc…) with simple fault analysis/ troubleshooting and resolution tasks (i.e. card replacement; cable connection/ replacement; etc…)

Title: Network Operations
Description:
Targeted Audience:

This learning path is of interest to those personnel whose daily tasks Includes: basic network and service OA&M procedures; more advanced surveillance and fault resolution responsibilities but must be completed within a maximum time frame before escalating to higher echelon for resolution.

Recommended training:

SR OS Product Overview, or equivalent knowledge. See IP Networks, IP/MPLS Product Overview for details.

Title: Network Engineering
Description:
Target Audience:

Those personnel who are responsible to design, implement and manage more complex configuration and fault resolution functions, including: QoS; Layer 1 – Layer 3 Resiliency; Policy Management; etc…

Recommended training: The courses in this collection deal with complex topics for which learners would benefit from having comprehensive understanding of the concepts and principles to configure, monitor and maintain an IP/MPLS based service network. Refer to the appropriate course description for details.

Title: FTTx Training & Certification
Description: contains all learning solutions of the FTTx Certification program

Title: SR OS
Description: This learning path addresses CLI-based labs.

Title: TOS36048 5620 SAM Network Troubleshooting using Fault Analysis
5620 SAM Fault Management Application
Description:
The 5620 SAM Fault Management Application course provides technical personnel and network operators with foundations for using the web-based Fault Management SAM application to perform network equipment monitoring and supervision; identify alarms against equipment and services; obtain details about alarm types, severity, status and correlation.

This course is intended to be instructor-led with a combination of theoretical discussion of these features followed by formal hands-on experiences designed to reinforce the principles and concepts introduced herein.
Prerequisites:
5620 SAM Fundamentals training (TOS36033 or TOS36033WS0K), or equivalent knowledge.

TOS36041-0001 5620 SAM IP/MPLS Network Provisioning Fundamentals, or equivalent knowledge
More information: Fault Management Application

Title: 5620 SAM Service Supervision Application
Description:
This 1-day hands-on course provides technical personnel and network operators with foundations for using the Service Supervision web-based application to perform IP/MPLS service monitoring and supervision; identify alarms against services; obtain details about service related alarm types, severity, status and correlation; perform KPI monitoring on user-defined service views and groups.

Attendees to this course will follow hands-on trouble scenarios using the Service Supervision application visualization to identify the root-cause of service issues and the related impact. Having identified that, student will use the 5620 SAM GUI to implement the required troubleshooting actions.

This course is intended to be instructor-led with a combination of theoretical discussion of these features followed by formal hands-on experiences designed to reinforce the principles and concepts introduced herein.
Prerequisites:
(TOS36033 or TOS36033W) 5620 SAM Fundamentals , or equivalent knowledge

TOS36042 5620 SAM Services Operation and Provisioning Fundamentals, or equivalent knowledge
More information: Service Supervision Application

Title: 5620 SAM Network Troubleshooting using Fault Analysis
Description:
This course provides network personnel with the advanced skills and best practices to isolate and identify network failures, then provide recommendation for, or perform, corrective action using the functions and features of the 5620 Service Aware Manager R14.0.

Students will be familiarized with the principles and concepts of end-to-end service management in an SR-OS network environment with a focus on the interaction of the various technologies and protocols to maintain successful communications.

The course is designed to present students with hands-on lab trouble scenarios for which the 5620 SAM R14.0 will be used to isolate, identify and recommend corrective actions for various practice faults introduced by the instructor.
Prerequisites: (TOS36033 or TOS36033WS)K) 5620 SAM Fundamentals, or equivalent knowledge
More information: Network Troubleshooting using Fault Analysis

Title: Service Management Platform (SMP)
Description: The Nokia Motive Service Management Platform (SMP) is the cornerstone of many successful omnichannel customer care solutions for home, mobile, small cell and enterprise devices and services across the globe. Compatible with multi-tenant environments and available with Software-as-a- Service (SaaS) deployment support, Motive SMP delivers the highest possible customer satisfaction at the lowest possible cost.

Title: SMP Technology Overview
Description:
In this course you will learn about the different aspects of the Motive SMP.

- Motive SMP process: For SMP to effectively serve the service provider, the system must be established to match the service provider's needs. The SMP process is the process in which SMP is established to successfully fulfill its intended purpose.

- Motive SMP's Customer Console (CSC)

- Motive SMP MORSE: An overview of the Motive SMP Object Repository for Services and Enterprises (MORSE) data model.

- Motive SMP Workflow buider

- Several Motive SMP use cases.

This learning package also includes the SMP Product Overview solution.
More information:
SMP Process, Architecture and Use cases - Full program (TAP15010K- 3h)

SMP Introduction (TAP03518K- 0.5h)

SMP Process, Architecture and Use cases (TAP03505K- 2.5h)

Title: SMP Product Overview
Description: In this training module you will receive a brief introduction to the Motive SMP platform.
More information: SMP Introduction (TAP03518K- 0.5h)

Title: SMP Network Administrator
Description:
One of the prime components of SMP is the Workflow Builder. The Workflow Builder allows service providers to quickly create, deploy, and test customer care and service troubleshooting workflows. Workflow designers are equipped with an out-of-the-box palette of Flow Control, Control Transfer, Display, and Device/Service Operation objects.

In this training solution, you will learn how to master the Workflow builder administration, SMP Administration and reporting.

This learning package also includes the SMP Technology solution.
More information:
SMP Administrator - Full program (TAP15011K- 15h)

SMP Introduction (TAP03518K- 0.5h)

SMP Process, Architecture and Use cases (TAP03505K- 2.5h)

SMP Administration and Reporting (TAP03075K- 6h)

SMP Workflow Builder Administration (TAP03072K- 6h)

Title: Home Device Manager (HDM)
Description: The Motive HDM (Home Device Manager) is part of the Customer Care solution. It allows you to configure remotely the customer premises equipment based on the TR-069 protocol. In this course you will learn how to configure device types and devices and also the actions and policies that you can launch on a CPE. You will also create actions and policies. The course also includes demonstrations and hands-on procedures for configuring some activation scenarios.

Title: HDM Technology Overview
Description:
In this training module you will learn more about the architecture and the different components of the Motive HDM. as well as the underlying protocols (like TR-069) to configure the end-user devices.

Additionally the Motive HDM Support template tool is explained.

This learning package also includes the HDM Product Overview solution.
More information:
HDM Architecture and Protocols & HDM Support Template - Full program (TAP15007K- 2h)

HDM Fundamentals: Positioning (TAP03516K- 0.5h)

HDM Architecture and Protocols (TAP03506K- 1h)

You will also learn the HDM operations, by practicing Device type and Device creation, activation, and management. They will also work with functions, actions and policies and analyze the outcome of these on devices. Finally, you will understand the reports.

Title: 5620 SAM IP/MPLS Network Provisioning Fundamentals
Description:
This course consists of a combination of theoretical discussion to develop an understanding of, and practical hands-on exercises to reinforce, the basic concepts and principles associated with deploying, monitoring and maintaining IP/MPLS transport, including: hardware configuration; SR OS interface types; IPv4 and IPv6 support; single area OSPF management domain, single area ISIS management domain, static LSP, basic LDP signaled LSPs, and basic RSVP-TE signaled LSPs.

It is targeted to network personnel who are new the IP/ MPLS technologies in an SR OS based network product environment with a focus on using the Nokia 5620 SAM (Service Aware Manager) as the primary management interface.

NOTE: For more extensive content tailoring, please contact your NokiaEDU representative or the NokiaEDU Global Contact Center listed at https://networks.nokia.com/nokiaedu
Prerequisites: TOS36033WS0K, or equivalent knowledge
More information: IP/MPLS Network Provisioning Fundamentals

Title: 5620 SAM Services Operations & Provisioning Fundamentals
Description:
The content in this training is intended to develop a good understanding of the technologies and principles to configure, monitor, and perform basic troubleshooting of Ethernet based customer services in an SR OS-based environment, including: understanding the SR OS service model; understanding simple Ethernet services (ePipe, VPLS and IES); service templates; and, service OAM tools.

This course is a combination of theoretical discussion and hands-on practical exercises using the 5602 SAM Release 14.0 as the primary management interface.
Prerequisites:
TOS36033WS0K 5620 SAM Fundamentals, or equivalent knowledge.

TOS36041-0001 5620 SAM Rel14.0 IP/MPLS Network Provisioning - Fundamentals, or equivalent knowledge
More information: 5620 SAM Services Operations & Provisioning Fundamentals

Title: 5620 SAM Services Operations and Provisioning Fundamentals
Description:
This 1-day hands-on course provides technical personnel and network operators with foundations for using the Service Supervision web-based application to perform IP/MPLS service monitoring and supervision; identify alarms against services; obtain details about service related alarm types, severity, status and correlation; perform KPI monitoring on user-defined service views and groups.

Attendees to this course will follow hands-on trouble scenarios using the Service Supervision application visualization to identify the root-cause of service issues and the related impact. Having identified that, student will use the 5620 SAM GUI to implement the required troubleshooting actions.

This course is intended to be instructor-led with a combination of theoretical discussion of these features followed by formal hands-on experiences designed to reinforce the principles and concepts introduced herein.
Prerequisites:
(TOS36033 or TOS36033WS0K) 5620 SAM Fundamentals, or equivalent job knowledge.

TOS36042-0001 5620 SAM Services Operation and Provisioning Fundamentals, or equivalent knowledge
More information: Services Operations & Provisioning Fundamentals

Title: 620 SAM R14.0 Service Operations and Provisioning - Enhanced OAM
Description:
The content in this training is intended to develop a good understanding of the technologies and principles to configure, monitor, and perform basic troubleshooting of Virtual Private Routed Networks (VPRN) in addition to understanding the enhanced OAM (Operations, Administration and Maintenance) tools included in the 5620 SAM, including: Mirror services; IEEE 802.1ag CFM (Connectivity Fault Management); ITU-T Y.1731 CFM; MEF EFM (Metro Ethernet Forum Ethernet First Mile); and, the proprietary Copy/ Move function for SAPs (Service Access Points) and Services.

This course is a combination of theoretical discussion and hands-on practical exercises using the 5602 SAM Release 14.0 as the primary management interface.
Prerequisites: TOS36041-0001 5620 SAM IP/MPLS Network Provisioning Enhanced OAM
More information: Type your text

Title: 5620 SAM IP/MPLS Network Provisioning - Multi-Area Scaling
Description:
The content in this training is intended to develop a good understanding of the technologies and principles to configure, monitor, and troubleshooting multi-area scaling and path management in an SR OS -based IP/MPLS transport network, including: Admin Groups and SRLG; soft pre-emptive LSP; scaling multi-area IRP routing domains; CSPF_on_loose_hop; and, LDP over RSVP.

This course is a combination of theoretical discussion and hands-on practical exercises using the 5620 SAM Release 14.0 as the primary management interface, though CLI (Command Line Interface) will be used where necessary.
Prerequisites: TOS36041-0001 5620 SAM IP/MPLS Network Provisioning Fundamnetals, or equivalent knowledge
More information: IP/MPLS Network Provisioning - Multi-Area Scaling

Title: 5620 SAM R14.0 Service Operations and Provisioning - Enhanced OAM
Description:
The content in this training is intended to develop a good understanding of the technologies and principles to configure, monitor, and perform basic troubleshooting of Virtual Private Routed Networks (VPRN) in addition to understanding the enhanced OAM (Operations, Administration and Maintenance) tools included in the 5620 SAM, including: Mirror services; IEEE 802.1ag CFM (Connectivity Fault Management); ITU-T Y.1731 CFM; MEF EFM (Metro Ethernet Forum Ethernet First Mile); and, the proprietary Copy/ Move function for SAPs (Service Access Points) and Services.

This course is a combination of theoretical discussion and hands-on practical exercises using the 5602 SAM Release 14.0 as the primary management interface.
Prerequisites: TOS36041-0001 5620 SAM IP/MPLS Network Provisioning, or equivalent knpowledge
More information: Service Operations & Provisioning - Enhanced OAM

Title: 5620 SAM IP/MPLS Network Provisioning – Resiliency
Description:
The content in this training is intended to develop a good understanding of the technologies and principles to configure, monitor, and troubleshooting resiliency techniques in an SR OS -based IP/MPLS transport network, including: Ethernet physical layer; IRP (Internal Routing Protocol); and, both LDP and RSVP-TE LSP protection mechanisms.

This course is a combination of theoretical discussion and hands-on practical exercises using the 5620 SAM Release 14.0 as the primary management interface, though CLI (Command Line Interface) may be used where necessary..
More information: IP/MPLS Network Provisioning- Resiliency

Title: 5620 SAM R14.0 Services Operation and Provisioning - Service Interconnection
Description:
The content in this training is intended to develop a good understanding of the technologies and principles to configure, monitor, and use the appropriate tools to validate interconnected services within an SR OS based service network, including: SC (Service Connectors); SCP (Service Connection Points); Routed VPLS; RCA (Root Cause Analysis) Audit; and, applying QoS policies.

This course is a combination of theoretical discussion and hands-on practical exercises using the 5602 SAM Release 14.0 as the primary management interface.
Prerequisites: TOS36042-0001 5620 SAM R14.0 Service Operation and Provisioning – Fundamentals, or equivalent knowledge
More information: Services Operation and Provisioning - Service Interconnection

Title: 5620 SAM System Administration
Description: The SAM (Service Aware Manager) System Administration course provides students with an overview of the tasks commonly associated with maintaining the integrity and operational efficiency of the 5620 SAM system. The course organizes the tasks into the functional categories of Operating System, Application, Network Connectivity, and Software Installation administration. The categories serve as a useful planning tool for customers with large-scale, distributed responsibility models.
Prerequisites: (TOS36033 or TOS36033WS0K) 5620 SAM Fundamentals, or equivalent knowledge
More information: System Administration

Title: 5620 SAM Policy Management
Description: The 5620 SAM Policy Management course provides hands-on, foundation knowledge on how to create, distribute, and manage network policy using the 5620 SAM.
Prerequisites: (TOS36033 or TOS34033WS0K) 5620 SAM Fundamentals, or equivalent knowledge
More information: Policy Management

Title: Internet of Things
Description: This collection is gathering all courses related to IoT. It contains an introduction to Internet of Things, describes Nokia's end-to-end IoT solution, describes the IMPACT IoT platform and the most important applications.

Title: Optical Networks Certifications
Description: The ONC program is designed to provide industry professionals with the training and skills needed to design, implement, and manage/maintain optical networks based on the Nokia 1830 Photonic Service Switch (PSS) and 1350 Optical Management System (OMS).

Title: Optical Network Architect
Description:
The first certification available in the Nokia Optical Network Certification (ONC) Program is the ONC-Architect. ONC-Architect is designed for intermediate to senior level professionals and focuses on advanced-level topics in the following principal areas:
  • Network design
  • Network management
  • Diagnostics and troubleshooting
Objectives: The ONC-Architect certification provides advanced training in optical network design, network management, and diagnostics and troubleshooting. Learning objectives covers important design topics, including network architectures, topology planning, traffic matrix analysis, amplification/regeneration, generalized multiprotocol path label switching (GMPLS), network element configuration in addition to other key optical networking areas. For network management, participants will gain skills in using the 1350 Optical Management System (OMS) to efficiently and effectively manage an 1830 PSS-based optical network with a focus on advanced areas of optical network construction, protection, and management. Participants will also acquire the knowledge needed to troubleshoot and resolve problems on the Nokia 1830 PSS using direct web and command line interfaces.
Duration: Course durations vary by course. Please refer to the course outline, available from the certification website, for further information. Courses are available as Instructor-led training and Virtual instructor-led training.
Prerequisites: Recommended prerequisites for ONC-Architect courses vary by course, and participants should refer to the prerequisites section included in each of the course outlines available from the ONC website. At a minimum, participants should have knowledge in optical transmission concepts and standard equipment, optical fiber types, basics of optical transport network (OTN), wavelength division multiplexing (WDM), optical time-domain reflectometer (OTDR), generalized multiprotocol path label switching (GMPLS), and other fundamental optical network subjects and topics. Familiarity with the Nokia 1800 PSS, 1350 OMS, and Engineering and Planning Tool (EPT) are also recommended.

Title: Nokia Mobile Routing Professional (MRP) Certification
Description: The Nokia Mobile Routing Professional (MRP) certification focuses on teaching the skills and best practices needed for designing and delivering scalable, highly-reliable IP/MPLS mobile networks and services. A professional workforce certified at the Mobile Routing Professional level provides operators with significant network, operational and business advantages. Benefits include faster time-to-market, higher reliability and availability, stronger operational efficiencies and high scalability for delivering profitable mobile services.
Objectives:
MRP Key Learning Outcomes

Upon successfully obtaining MRP certification, students will have developed a strong technical and working level understanding of the design and implementation principles of IP/MPLS mobile backhaul and evolved packet core networks including architectures, components, interfaces, and best practices. While the certification focuses on Nokia service routing technology, students can leverage the knowledge and skill gained and apply them to any standardized 2G, 3G or LTE mobile transport environment. Refer to the MRP certification brochure for further details on learning objectives.
Duration: Please refer to the Certification details for more information.
Prerequisites:
Certification Requirements

Exam requirements and recommended courses for acquiring the MRP certification are provided in the table below. Candidates are not required to enroll in the recommended course to achieve the MRP certification however passing the mandatory exams and the NRS II and MRP practical lab exams are required.

For the certification exams below, candidates have the option to write the single NRS II Composite Exam (4A0-C01) OR write the following three individual exams.

Nokia Interior Routing Protocols (4A0-101)

Nokia Multiprotocol Label Switching (4A0-103)

Nokia Services Architecture (4A0-104)

The NRS II Composite Exam (4A0-C01) combines content from three individual exams into a single, integrated exam. Refer to the NRS II Composite exam page for further details.

For the recertification exams below, candidates have the option to write either the 4A0-M01 OR the 4A0-M02 exam.
More information: Nokia Mobile Routing Professional (MRP) Certification

Title: NSP/ NFM-P Fundamentals
Description: This NFM-P (Network Functions Manager - Packet) Fundamentals provides technical personnel and network operators with foundations for using SAM to: perform network equipment discovery, management, monitoring and supervision; identify alarms rose against equipment and services; obtain details about alarm management and filtering, and alarm types, severity, status and correlation.
Objectives:
Course Objectives

Upon completion of this course, student will be able to:

● List the NFM-P functions and main features

● Describe the GUI workspace customization capabilities and identify the workspace elements that can be customized

● Use the NFM-P navigation tree views to perform equipment management operations

● Discover and view network element (NE) devices in the NFM-P GUI Use NFM-P topology maps to manage the network and display the status of network devices and services

● Generate file inventory lists for a managed device or for the entire network

● Use the NFM-P GUI to identify alarms raised against equipment and services, including alarm types, severity, status and correlation details

● Use the dynamic alarm list to filter and search for alarms, display correlated alarms, view alarm history and open alarm information details

● Identify the NFM-P statistics collection capabilities

● Use the NFM-P to collect, display and save to a file performance statistics in tabular or graphical forms for selected objects

Prerequisites: Recommended prerequisites for Nuage Networks Virtuoso certification courses vary by course, and participants should refer to the prerequisites section included in each of the course outlines available from the Virtuoso website. Knowledge and experience with IP networks, VPN services, and basic Linux operating system commands are recommended. Experience with Nuage Networks Virtualized Services Platform (VSP) and Virtualized Network Services (VNS) would be helpful.
More information: Nuage Networks Virtuoso (NNV) Certification

Title: Nuage Networks Virtualized Services Platform (VSP) Fundamentals (TTP36005)
Description: this course is designed for service providers, web-scale operators, and enterprises needing to understand the technology, techniques, and best practices for implementing a software defined networking (SDN) solution for datacenters using the Nuage Networks Virtualized Services Platform (VSP).
Prerequisites: Recommended Prerequisites: Knowledge and experience with IP/MPLS networks and BGP-based VPN services
More information: Nuage Networks Virtualized Services Platform (VSP) Fundamentals (TTP36005)

Title: Nuage Networks Virtualized Network Services (VNS) Fundamentals (TTP36009)
Description: This course is designed for service providers, web-scale operators and enterprises needing to understand the technology, techniques, and best practices for implementing an SDN solution using Nuage Networks Virtualized Network Services (VNS). The course provides detailed coverage of the Nuage Networks VNS components, and practical exercises using VNS to implement software defined WAN services.
Prerequisites: Recommended Prerequisites: Knowledge and experience with IP/MPLS networks and BGP-based VPN services, Basic Knowledge of KVM and VMware hypervisors
More information: Nuage Networks Virtualized Network Services (VNS) Fundamentals (TTP36009)

Title: Nuage Networks Virtualized Services Platform (VSP) Software Installation (TTP36006)
Description: This course is designed for individuals who need to understand the requirements for, and to perform the software installation of the Nuage Networks Virtualized Service Platform (VSP). The course provides practical experience verifying and configuring the hardware and software environment as well as troubleshooting common installation problems.
Prerequisites: Recommended Prerequisites: Basic knowledge of KVM and VMware hypervisors, Linux operating system and commands
More information: Nuage Networks Virtualized Services Platform (VSP) Software Installation (TTP36006)

Title: Nuage Networks Virtualized Services Platform (VSP) Operations (TTP36007)
Description: This course is designed for network operators who are responsible for datacenter operations, including the Nuage Networks Virtualized Services Platform (VSP) and Virtualized Services Assurance Platform (VSAP). This course provides hands-on operations experience with the Nuage Networks VSP, including troubleshooting and log file management, as well as maintenance and operations using VSAP.
Prerequisites: Recommended Prerequisites: Knowledge and experience with IP/MPLS networks and BGP-based VPN services are recommended. Experience with Nuage Networks VSP would be helpful.
More information: Nuage Networks Virtualized Services Platform (VSP) Operations (TTP36007)

Title: Nuage Networks OpenStack Integration (TTP36011)
Description: This course is designed for IT operators and network administrators responsible for the support and operation of an integrated Nuage Networks/OpenStack network. This course provides an in-depth look at the OpenStack and Nuage Networks Virtual Services Platform (VSP) architecture. Installation of the Nuage Networks plug-ins and techniques to verify the deployment operation will be presented. For common networking scenarios, the theory, configuration, and troubleshooting techniques are presented. Students practice what they learn during numerous hands-on lab exercises.
Prerequisites: Recommended Prerequisites: Nuage Networks VSP Fundamentals (Course number TTP36005), Basic working knowledge of OpenStack
More information: Nuage Networks OpenStack Integration (TTP36011)

Title: Delta Training for Network Design / Planning Engineer
